text: Bernard Judge (January 6, 1940 â€“ June 14, 2019) was an American journalist. He was in management positions at the City News Bureau of Chicago, the Chicago Tribune, the Chicago Sun-Times and the Chicago Daily Law Bulletin. He was born in South Side, Chicago. He was raised in Oak Park, Illinois. Judge left the Chicago Sun-Times to become the editor and vice president of the Chicago Daily Law Bulletin. Judge became the Law Bulletin's publisher in 2001. Judge died from pancreatic cancer at his Chicago home on June 14, 2019, aged 79. ==References== Category:1940 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from pancreatic cancer Category:Cancer deaths in Chicago Category:Journalists from Chicago Category:Writers from Oak Park, Illinois
